attributes.action: Honour HMG commitment to international law and pursue a conviction against Tony Blair for war crime
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tony Blair has admitted publicly that he advanced the argument for war against Iraq on personal feelings and beliefs. He is quoted as saying if his alleged claim of WMD was unfounded he would have pursued the war regardless. Falsifying facts to achieve a personal goal on this scale  is in fundamental oposition to the rule of international law. There is a case to answer. It should follow it's natural course in moral and legal impunity with a view to securing a conviction.

rejection.details:
The PM can not pursue a conviction. Only the police or CPS can do this. 
A petition you may want to look at can be found at: 
http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/TonyBlairandWMD/
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
